net.xarql.util

Class Base62Converter

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xarql.util.Base62Converter

  • public class Base62Converter
extends java.lang.Object
    Converts base 10 numbers to base 62 and vice versa. Example: 873 = E5
    Author:
    Bryan Johnson

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • from

        public static int from(java.lang.String input)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Converts a base 62 number (represented as a String) to a base 10 number (represented as an int). Example: E5; 873
        Parameters:
        input - String representing a base 62 number
        Returns:
        An int equal to the input
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When an illegal character is in the input

      • pow

        private static int pow(int number,
                       int power)
        Custom "to the power of" method for determining exponential values. For whatever reason Math.pow() didn't work properly for this use case. The output might suffer from an integer overflow if the arguments are too large.
        Parameters:
        number - The base number
        power - The exponent
        Returns:
        number^power

      • buildCharacterMap

        private static void buildCharacterMap()
        Constructs the Map the holds the values for each valid char in a base 62 number String

      • getCharValues

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Character> getCharValues()
        Returns:
        built charValues

      • to

        public static java.lang.String to(int input)
        Converts a base 10 number (represented as an int) to a base 62 number (represented as an String). Example: 873; E5
        Parameters:
        input - any int
        Returns:
        A String equal to the input
